name: Subhasish Das
title: M.Sc Tech Engineering Physics
about: A passionate and driven student at NIT Warangal with a strong foundation in embedded systems, FPGA design, and electronics. Eager to apply my skills in real-world challenges and contribute to innovative hardware and software solutions.

education.degree: West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education

internships.description: Worked on Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) simulations to model and validate molecular dynamics, enhancing computational efficiency and physical accuracy in complex molecular systems.

Integrated custom IP and built a complete SoC on Zynq-7000 FPGA using Xilinx Vivado and Vitis, for high-performance embedded processing. Learned about on-chip communication, IP integration, and designing a complete SOC using a softcore processor.

projects.title: STM32 Peripheral Driver Development
projects.description: Developed custom GPIO, SPI, USART, and I2C drivers for the STM32F4 microcontroller family. Configured GPIOs and wrote APIs for serial communication protocols.

projects.title: IoT-Based Temperature & Humidity Monitoring System
projects.description: Built a real-time sensor data logging system using ESP32, DHT11, and Firebase Realtime Database. Interfaced DHT11 with ESP32 to collect and transmit sensor data to the cloud.

projects.title: 12-Hour Digital Clock on FPGA (Artix-7)
projects.description: Designed and implemented a modular digital clock using SystemVerilog on an Artix-7 FPGA. Developed timekeeping logic, simulated the design in Vivado, and validated on-board.
